Posts.EditableText: It figures, on the day I provide a link to my game on Facebook... At this URL: http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... iq/spondre when you click Play Online, you get: Error: The remote server returned an error: (404) Not Found. [Sorry, an error occurred] The "no menu" version seems ok.
Posts.HTML:
It figures, on the day I provide a link to my game on Facebook...

At this URL:

http://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/ ... iq/spondre

when you click Play Online, you get:

Error: The remote server returned an error: (404) Not Found.
[Sorry, an error occurred]

The "no menu" version seems ok.

Posts.EditableText: Also, if I log in, then the first one works.
Posts.HTML: Also, if I log in, then the first one works.

Posts.EditableText:
Just pasting my email reply:

Thanks, I've fixed this now.

When you're not logged in, you access a newer version of Quest's WebPlayer, which loads games differently - using Azure instead of the WebPlayer server's local file system.

It seems you've updated your game's unique id at some point? Your game's listing was associated with an id of f3dff9d5-f7e2-408b-a37d-5469490bebba but it was loading resources from 4e3a98aa-1b7c-41d1-9e97-666cbed97dc8. I've re-pointed the listing to the new id so it can find the game file now.
Posts.HTML:
Just pasting my email reply:

Thanks, I've fixed this now.

When you're not logged in, you access a newer version of Quest's WebPlayer, which loads games differently - using Azure instead of the WebPlayer server's local file system.

It seems you've updated your game's unique id at some point? Your game's listing was associated with an id of f3dff9d5-f7e2-408b-a37d-5469490bebba but it was loading resources from 4e3a98aa-1b7c-41d1-9e97-666cbed97dc8. I've re-pointed the listing to the new id so it can find the game file now.
